CatDescriptText: Loise Bates, stock clerk, Homewood was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 26, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think a Negro will be named to fill the police inspectorship vacancy created by the resignation of Inspector Albert Jones?" Answer reads: "I've read a lot about Lieutenant Leo Anderson and I think he should get it, because he is alert, ambitious and pushes ahead on his own.  I doubt, however, he will receive the appointment."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Loise Bates wearing fedora and plaid shirt, standing in front of mosaic tiled building with store window
